CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Flash Newspicture Magazine, March 22, 1938, pg. unknown, reads: "Pittsburgh's Queen and Her Royal Court in all their feminine glory. Ruth Gwynn of the Baroness Club, who was crowned queen of the colorful Mardi Gras of the Society of the Lancer held in Pittsburgh's Syria Mosque.  Miss Gwynn seated in center is surrounded by her charming attendants, and her maids, l to r: Beatrice West, Barbara Jones, Ruth Gwynn, Decatur Greenlee and Elsie Brown all charming Smoketown socialites who helped the Lancers celebrate their annual Mardi Gras fete. (Photo by 'Teenie' Harris).
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, seated from left: Beatrice West, Barbara Jones, "queen" Ruth Gwynn, Elsie Brown, Decatur Jones Greenlee; standing: Betty Harris fourth from left, and Cleo Blakney (Jones) sixth from left, posed in Syria Mosque for Society of Lancers Mardi Gras ball, another version
